title: Child Of Light
opening: ...Half a year has passed. The army of House Friege, led by Barat, has waged a relentless onslaught against Leonster, seeking to recapture the castle. Leif's Liberation Army has fought well, but has been gradually worn down and forced into a small corner of the castle—with no way out. Everyone could see it was only a matter of time until Castle Leonster fell...

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: How goes the war, Lord Barat?

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: Ah, Reinhardt. I've been waiting for you. You've brought my reinforcements, I trust?

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: A battalion is on its way here from Ulster. They should be arriving shortly.

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: Hmm... Yes, that should do it. We've already seized most of the castle. These few halls are the rebels' last refuge.

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: Normally that would be good news, but...

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: Hmm? What do you mean? Is something amiss?

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: This siege has gone on for half a year, yet Leonster still stands. King Bloom is... displeased. I don't mean to speak out of turn, especially to one of my elders, but... I'd suggest you hurry.

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: ...You're not telling me anything I don't already know.

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: The king's temper worsens by the day. The loss of Prince Ishtore at Fort Melgen has been taking its toll on him...

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: What of the Isaachian rebels?

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: I hear they've already crossed the border into the Thracian Peninsula. But they're not entering unopposed: Cowen and the 26th Battalion, Vampa and her sisters, as well as Lady Tine and her unit of mages, are all moving to intercept them. Still, the rebels were able to best Lady Liza... I fear the coming battle will be a most arduous one indeed.

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: And what does His Highness himself intend to do?

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: I believe the king plans to personally take command of the troops at Ulster. Should the Isaachian rebels break through to the city, I imagine he'll send for you. But if Leonster should still remain in enemy hands by that time, your future will be... most uncertain.

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: Ah... Very well. You've made yourself clear.

intro.speaker: Reinhardt
intro.line: Then I must be returning to Conote. If you'll excuse me...

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: You! Get over here!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Uh... Y-Yes, sir?

intro.speaker: Barat
intro.line: Send word to all the troops: we're launching an all-out assault on Castle Leonster! There will be no retreat! Fight with all your soul if you want to live!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: ...The enemy has begun their assault, Prince Leif.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Can we mount a defense?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: I've already ordered as much. Everyone that can stand upright is fortifying the castle. If we fall here, we have nowhere to run.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: We've done quite well against such an enormous army, considering everything. Holding out for half a year, under siege... But we'll reach our limit before long.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Bah, you've become overfond of such feeble whining. It's unseemly for a prince of your stature. If you're not willing to fight to the last breath, you're betraying the memory of all who have sacrificed themselves to get us this far! Don't forget the bigger picture! We're keeping the bulk of the enemy's forces busy here, which frees Seliph's army to march through Thracia unimpeded! You mustn't give up before we're able to merge our forces!

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: I'm sorry, August. I know... And I do want to meet Lord Seliph myself, but how else do you expect me to feel, having to watch our soldiers die one by one?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: If it pains you so, that's all the more reason to honor their memory by fighting to the last man!

boss.speaker: Barat
boss.line: You nuisances have cost me my rank!

battle.speaker: August
battle.line: Prince Leif, the Friege army has captured the throne! Our troops are fleeing en masse! Our war... is over...

end.speaker: August
end.line: Prince Leif, the enemy is retreating!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: What?! Why would they do that?

end.speaker: August
end.line: Because Seliph's army has arrived! They've already surrounded Castle Ulster, and are mounting an assault as we speak! This is our salvation! We've done it! We're saved!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Truly...? Lord Seliph... has... Hold a moment, August. How do you know this?

end.speaker: August
end.line: Ah, listen to me go on... I've forgotten myself. Just now, an emissary of Lord Seliph arrived. He awaits you inside the other chamber.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Lord Seliph's emissary?! I must meet him! Please, send him in!

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: So we meet at last, Prince Leif. I'm a soldier in the service of Lord Seliph. I go by Diarmuid.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Diarmuid?! But that would make you... Are you Nanna's older brother?!

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: I am.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Was there anything else you needed to tell me on behalf of Lord Seliph?

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: No, sire.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Then now that that's done, it's my honor to introduce you to Nanna.

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Diarmuid... Brother...

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: Nanna?! Nanna, it's really you!

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: I'm so sorry it took me such a long time to find you... If I had just known you were here from the start, I would've dropped everything to be by your side. I only finally learned of you through Lord Lewyn...

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Lord Lewyn...?

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: He's Lord Seliph's tactician. There's nothing the man doesn't know... And he told me about Mother, too... How she was trying to reach Isaach, but vanished in the Aed Desert...

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: Ah! She's... not with you? I... I see... I had resigned myself to the fact that I'd likely never see her again, but even so... Mother... Oh, gods...

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: I'm sorry, Nanna. Mother was traveling all that way for me...

end.speaker: Nanna
end.line: No, don't think like that. I used to resent her for leaving, but now that I'm older, I understand how Mother felt... All women feel the same deep love for their children. I've seen as much...

end.speaker: Diarmuid
end.line: I haven't given up, Nanna. Lord Lewyn said Mother was still alive. We can search for her together when the war is finally over. So... don't cry anymore, OK? Prince Leif, I have a request, if I may. Would you permit me to transfer into your army? I'll ask Lord Seliph for his leave to do so once we rejoin him.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Of course! I'd be glad to have you along to support Nanna. I'll explain the situation to Lord Seliph.
